title: Miscellaneous item
data:
In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, a **miscellaneous item** may be created as part of a [monster's inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") when the monster is generated.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)
- [2 Usage](#Usage)
- [3 See also](#See_also)
- [4 References](#References)

## Description

Monsters may be generated with a miscellaneous item if that monster's level equals or exceeds the roll of a d100.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

The following monster types are ineligible for miscellaneous items:

- [Animals](/wiki/Animal "Animal")
- Monsters with [explosion attacks](/wiki/Explosion_attack "Explosion attack")
- [Mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless") monsters
- [Ghosts](/wiki/Ghost "Ghost") and [shades](/wiki/Shade "Shade")
- [Keystone Kops](/wiki/Keystone_Kop_\(monster_class\) "Keystone Kop (monster class)") of any rank

In addition, regular [soldiers](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") have a 12/13 chance of missing out on the miscellaneous item roll.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

If the [monster difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty") is 5 or less, it has a 1⁄30 chance of receiving a polymorph item, which will be a [wand of polymorph](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph") 1⁄6th of the time, or else a [potion of polymorph](/wiki/Potion_of_polymorph "Potion of polymorph"). Otherwise, if the monster is living (e.g excluding [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead"), [golems](/wiki/Golem "Golem"), and [vortices](/wiki/Vortices "Vortices") among others), it has a 1⁄40 chance of receiving an [amulet of life saving](/wiki/Amulet_of_life_saving "Amulet of life saving").

Otherwise, the monster gets an item from one of these sets, with each set equally likely:

- a [wand of speed monster](/wiki/Wand_of_speed_monster "Wand of speed monster") (1⁄6th of the time) or a [potion of speed](/wiki/Potion_of_speed "Potion of speed")
- a [wand of make invisible](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible") (1⁄6th of the time) or a [potion of invisibility](/wiki/Potion_of_invisibility "Potion of invisibility") - or neither if the monster is [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful") and the player cannot currently [see invisible](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible")
- a [potion of gain level](/wiki/Potion_of_gain_level "Potion of gain level")

[Guards](/wiki/Guard "Guard") will not use [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")-boosting items, and according to the code are not meant to receive them - however, `mtmp->isgd` is only set after `makemon()` is called, thus making it possible for them to generate with one. In practice, this only means that you will occasionally find a potion of speed or wand of speed monster in a deceased guard's inventory.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) [\[4\]](#cite_note-4)

## Usage

[Intelligent monsters](/wiki/Intelligent_monster "Intelligent monster") with hands will use miscellaneous items when they are within 6 tiles Euclidean distance of you, with some exceptions:[\[5\]](#cite_note-5)[\[6\]](#cite_note-6)

- Guards, shopkeepers, and priests will not quaff a cursed potion of gain level.
- Peaceful, non-invisible monsters will not use a wand of make invisible or potion of invisibility, unless you can see invisible.
- Guards will not use a potion of speed or wand of speed monster.

## See also

- [Death drop](/wiki/Death_drop "Death drop")
- [Defensive item](/wiki/Defensive_item "Defensive item")
- [Offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item")
- [Monster starting inventory](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 796](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/makemon.c#L796)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 791](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/makemon.c#L791)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/vault.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 387](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/vault.c#L387)
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1731](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/muse.c#L1731)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1644](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/muse.c#L1644)
6. [↑](#cite_ref-6) [src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1679](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/muse.c#L1679)

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.](/images/5/57/Nh366-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.6. Click here for more information.")
html:
Miscellaneous item

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search

In NetHack, a miscellaneous item may be created as part of a monster's inventory when the monster is generated.

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Usage
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Description

Monsters may be generated with a miscellaneous item if that monster's level equals or exceeds the roll of a d100.[1]

The following monster types are ineligible for miscellaneous items:

  • Animals
  • Monsters with explosion attacks
  • Mindless monsters
  • Ghosts and shades
  • Keystone Kops of any rank

In addition, regular soldiers have a 12/13 chance of missing out on the miscellaneous item roll.[2]

If the monster difficulty is 5 or less, it has a 1⁄30 chance of receiving a polymorph item, which will be a wand of polymorph 1⁄6th of the time, or else a potion of polymorph. Otherwise, if the monster is living (e.g excluding undead, golems, and vortices among others), it has a 1⁄40 chance of receiving an amulet of life saving.

Otherwise, the monster gets an item from one of these sets, with each set equally likely:

  • a wand of speed monster (1⁄6th of the time) or a potion of speed
  • a wand of make invisible (1⁄6th of the time) or a potion of invisibility - or neither if the monster is peaceful and the player cannot currently see invisible
  • a potion of gain level

Guards will not use speed-boosting items, and according to the code are not meant to receive them - however, mtmp->isgd is only set after makemon() is called, thus making it possible for them to generate with one. In practice, this only means that you will occasionally find a potion of speed or wand of speed monster in a deceased guard's inventory.[3] [4]

Usage

Intelligent monsters with hands will use miscellaneous items when they are within 6 tiles Euclidean distance of you, with some exceptions:[5][6]

  • Guards, shopkeepers, and priests will not quaff a cursed potion of gain level.
  • Peaceful, non-invisible monsters will not use a wand of make invisible or potion of invisibility, unless you can see invisible.
  • Guards will not use a potion of speed or wand of speed monster.

See also

  • Death drop
  • Defensive item
  • Offensive item
  • Monster starting inventory

References

  1. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 796
  2. ↑ src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 791
  3. ↑ src/vault.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 387
  4. ↑ src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1731
  5. ↑ src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1644
  6. ↑ src/muse.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 1679

Otherwise, if the monster is living (e.g excluding [[undead]], [[golem]]s, and [[vortices]] among others), it has a {{frac|40}} chance of receiving an [[amulet of life saving]]. Otherwise, the monster gets an item from one of these sets, with each set equally likely: * a [[wand of speed monster]] ({{frac|6}}th of the time) or a [[potion of speed]] * a [[wand of make invisible]] ({{frac|6}}th of the time) or a [[potion of invisibility]] - or neither if the monster is [[peaceful]] and the player cannot currently [[see invisible]] * a [[potion of gain level]] [[Guard]]s will not use [[speed]]-boosting items, and according to the code are not meant to receive them - however, mtmp->isgd is only set after makemon() is called, thus making it possible for them to generate with one. In practice, this only means that you will occasionally find a potion of speed or wand of speed monster in a deceased guard's inventory.{{refsrc|src/vault.c|387|version=NetHack 3.6.6}} {{refsrc|src/muse.c|1731|version=NetHack 3.6.6}} ==Usage== [[Intelligent monster]]s with hands will use miscellaneous items when they are within 6 tiles Euclidean distance of you, with some exceptions:{{refsrc|src/muse.c|1644|nethack=3.6.6}}{{refsrc|src/muse.c|1679|nethack=3.6.6}} * Guards, shopkeepers, and priests will not quaff a cursed potion of gain level. * Peaceful, non-invisible monsters will not use a wand of make invisible or potion of invisibility, unless you can see invisible. * Guards will not use a potion of speed or wand of speed monster. ==See also== * [[Death drop]] * [[Defensive item]] * [[Offensive item]] * [[Monster starting inventory]] == References == {{nethack-366}} [[Category:Monster Inventory]]
